analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin mkhyen nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu bshad de de thos pa dang rgyal po gzugs can snying pos lha stong phrag brgyad cu dang lhan cig tu 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu ye shes kyi
translated: The Blessed One, knowing his thoughts, dispositions, temperament, and nature, explained the Dharma in such a way that he realized the Four Noble Truths. Having heard it, King Bimbisāra, together with eighty thousand gods, with the vajra of wisdom,
